comments:
First of all, I'd like to applaud the progress in the Indexer/Code Assist side of things, they're starting to take shape nicely!

Running Eclipse 3.2RC1, CDT I20060418 on Linux/GCC 3.2.3, our project is running into an error when using the Fast Indexer (Stack trace at end).  Unfortunately I can't tell what is causing the error without more diagnostics.


I can dig for more information if requested, with an indication of what information would actually be useful.

I think I've figured out where the NPE could happen. I've has submitted a fix. Could you try to reproduce with tomorrows build? Thanks.

Wow... this time we get into a loop of exceptions :-)

Seems to be something to do with PDOM.getLinkage (line 299)


Every 5 seconds, we get an "Unhandled event loop exception" with no stack trace, followed by a "Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException)" with stack trace...

Try bringing up the currently hidden C++ Index view. Select your projects and invoke Rebuild from the context menu. This looks like a corrupt index.

The previous error loop was the result of requesting the indexer to reindex my project, I believe.

I deleted the index from the filesystem (workspace/.metadata/.plugins/I forget) and requested reindex again, and it completed successfully using I20060420blah.  I'm happy with this, will let you know if it gets corrupted again under normal usage.

Excellent work, looking forward to the Open Type related functionality ;-)
Excellent, thanks. Let me know if you see anything more.
